title: Refresh global theme to light-blue background, white cards, dark headings, and yellow primary buttons

requirements.summary: Update app-wide theme tokens and global styles to use the new light palette and remove the gradient/neon styling from the default (light) UI.
acceptanceCriteria: On all pages, the overall page background renders as a solid #D6F0FF (not a purple/pink/blue gradient).

Components using Tailwind theme colors (e.g., bg-background, bg-card, text-foreground, text-primary-foreground) reflect the new palette: cards/sections appear white and default text is readable on white/light blue.
Primary headings (h1–h6, or at minimum the existing styled heading selectors) render with #2B2B2B and no neon-glow styling that changes their perceived color away from #2B2B2B.

file_operations.description: Replace the current neon/gradient light-theme CSS variables in :root so Tailwind theme colors map to: background=#D6F0FF, card/sections=#FFFFFF, foreground/headings=#2B2B2B, and primary=#FFE066 with dark primary-foreground; convert these hex colors to appropriate OKLCH values to match the existing tailwind.config.js variable usage.

Remove/replace the body gradient background styling (linear-gradient using --background/--background-end) so the body (and/or root container) uses a solid background color derived from the updated --background token (targeting #D6F0FF).

Remove neon-glow styling from default heading selectors (currently h2–h6 text-shadow) so headings render as plain #2B2B2B; if glow is desired for dark mode only, scope the glow styles under the .dark selector rather than applying globally.

requirements.summary: Remove the App-level hardcoded gradient wrapper so the top-level UI uses the global theme background consistently across routes/pages.
acceptanceCriteria: The App-level wrapper no longer applies the purple/pink/blue gradient background classes.
Navigation between modules does not cause background color changes; the background remains #D6F0FF.

file_operations.description: Replace the top-level App container classes that apply the gradient background (bg-gradient-to-br from-purple-100 via-pink-100 to-blue-100) with classes that rely on the global theme background (e.g., bg-background) so the solid #D6F0FF applies across all pages.

Update the 'Coming Soon' fallback wrapper (currently using the same gradient background classes) to also rely on the global theme background so the background remains consistent when navigating to not-yet-implemented modules.

requirements.summary: Update primary button styling via theme tokens so primary buttons are yellow with dark text and do not use neon glow in hover/focus states.
acceptanceCriteria: Buttons that use the primary theme color display as yellow (#FFE066) with dark text.
Hover/focus states do not introduce neon glow/shadows that materially change the perceived button/text color away from yellow/dark text.
Button text remains readable and meets basic contrast expectations against the yellow background.

file_operations.description: Update the light-theme primary tokens so Tailwind 'primary' resolves to #FFE066 and 'primary-foreground' resolves to a dark color equivalent to #2B2B2B (using OKLCH values consistent with tailwind.config.js), ensuring existing shadcn/Tailwind button variants inherit the new palette without changing feature logic.

Remove or scope away the global neon button styling (button, .btn text-shadow and hover box-shadow/text-shadow) so hover/focus states keep the button yellow with dark text and do not add glow that alters perceived colors; if any glow is retained, limit it to .dark only.
